content:
• Tuesday, March 19, 2013
  • TRLG

    True Religion (NASDAQ:TRLG) says that founder, Chairman and CEO Jeff Lubell has decided to step...

    True Religion (NASDAQ:TRLG) says that founder, Chairman and CEO Jeff Lubell has decided to step down. He's agreed to serve as Chairman Emeritus and a creative consultant to the company for a period of two years. The board appoints its President, Lynne Koplin, to serve as interim CEO. It's also formed a special committee of non-management directors and hired financial and legal advisors to evaluate possible strategic alternatives. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 PM
  • WSM

    More on Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q4 easily beat across the board. Net earnings rose 9.1% Y/Y,...

    More on Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q4 easily beat across the board. Net earnings rose 9.1% Y/Y, while total same-store sales rose 4%. West Elm comp-brand sales were up 19%, Pottery Barn +4%, Pottery Barn Kids +7.7%. However, at Williams-Sonoma's namesake stores, comparable-brand sales dropped 1.6%. Direct-to-consumer sales, including catalog and online sales, rose 19%. Shares +5.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM
  • GEVO

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) +3.4% AH after winning a federal court ruling that it doesn’t infringe...

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) +3.4% AH after winning a federal court ruling that it doesn’t infringe a Butamax Advanced Biofuels (DD, BP) patent for a method to commercially produce isobutanol. Butamax had sued Gevo in 2011 alleging misuse of technology for genetically engineered microorganisms used to produce biofuels.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • FTEK

    More on Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK): Q4 misses as the engine emissions control company comes in flat...

    More on Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK): Q4 misses as the engine emissions control company comes in flat on a per share basis. Analysts had expected a gain of $0.05 per share. Revenues also came up short of Street estimates as total sales declined 5% Y/Y, wirh higher APC revenues offset by declines in its Fuel Chemicals segment. Shares -9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • EAC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EAC +13%. ADBE +6%. FRAN +6%. WSM +5%. GTI +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EAC +13%. ADBE +6%. FRAN +6%. WSM +5%. GTI +5%.
    After-hours top losers: RLJ -3%. CTAS -3%. TDW -2%. GTN -2%. INGR -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) declares $0.31/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous....

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM) declares $0.31/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 2.74%. For shareholders of record Apr. 26. Payable May 24. Ex-div date Apr. 24. The board declares share repurchase program of $750M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) +1.6% AH on news the Shenandoah-2 well in the deepwater Gulf of...

    Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) +1.6% AH on news the Shenandoah-2 well in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico encountered more than 1,000 net feet of oil pay, in one of its largest oil discoveries in the Gulf. APC is operator of the well; partners include COP +0.3%, CIE +4.3%, MRO +0.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • FTEK

    Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK): Q4 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $26.6M misses by $1.7M....

    Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK): Q4 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $26.6M misses by $1.7M. Shares -8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • FRAN

    More on Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN) Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue as total sales jump by over...

    More on Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN) Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue as total sales jump by over 40% Y/Y. Net earnings rose 78% as the retailer continues to rack up double-digit sales growth, aided by new store openings and improvements in its jewelry and clothing segments. For the current quarter, the company forecast an EPS of $0.25 - $0.26 on net sales of $79.5M to $80.5M. Street estimates are for $0.26 on $78M in sales. Same-store sales are expected to rise by 4% to 5% for the current quarter and full year, with 80 new stores expected to open through FY13. Shares +3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • PRMW

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW): Q4 EPS of -$3.11. Revenue of $20.9M misses by $3.87M. Shares -9.5%...

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW): Q4 EPS of -$3.11. Revenue of $20.9M misses by $3.87M. Shares -9.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q4 EPS of $1.34 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.41B beats by $0.01B....

    Williams-Sonoma (NYSE:WSM): Q4 EPS of $1.34 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.41B beats by $0.01B. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • FRAN

    Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q4 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $86.7M (+40.6% Y/Y) beats...

    Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q4 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $86.7M (+40.6% Y/Y) beats by $1.81M. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • MEMP

    Memorial Production Partners (NASDAQ:MEMP) -3.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 8.5M...

    Memorial Production Partners (NASDAQ:MEMP) -3.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 8.5M common units. MEMP intends to use net proceeds to fund part of yesterday's pending $200M acquisition of oil and natural gas properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • EAC

    Erickson Air-Crane (NASDAQ:EAC) buys Evergreen Helicopters from Evergreen International...

    Erickson Air-Crane (NASDAQ:EAC) buys Evergreen Helicopters from Evergreen International Aviation, for $250M, essentially doubling the size of the company. The sale consists of $185M in cash, $17.5M in unsecured promissory notes issued by EAC, and approximately 4M convertible preferred shares valued at $47.5M. In 2012, Evergreen’s revenue was $196M and adjusted EBITDA was $56.2M, representing margins of over 25%. Shares +2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ1 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.008B (-4% Y/Y) beats...

    Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ1 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.008B (-4% Y/Y) beats by $22M. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • PIKE

    Pike Electric (PIKE -5.7%) trades lower today after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares from Buy to...

    Pike Electric (PIKE -5.7%) trades lower today after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares from Buy to Hold on valuation and removed its price target on the stock. The stock is trading on heavy volume, with more than 960K shares changing hands, which is more than triple the 3-month daily average.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • RMTI

    Rockwell Medical (RMTI -15%) gets pounded today, setting a 52-week low after reporting late...

    Rockwell Medical (RMTI -15%) gets pounded today, setting a 52-week low after reporting late yesterday that its Q4 loss per share widened to $0.66 from $0.48 as its bottom line was negatively impacted by higher clinical development expenses. Clinical development expense was $48.3 million compared to $17.8 million in. The company notes that sales rose 9% to $13M, but the result still came in slightly below the consensus forecasts of $13.04M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • AFFY

    It's a bad day for Affymax (OTC:AFFY), with the stock plunging 64% and hitting a new year low...

    It's a bad day for Affymax (OTC:AFFY), with the stock plunging 64% and hitting a new year low after announcing late Monday that it's slashing 75% of its workforce and considering filing for bankruptcy protection. The company is hiring a bank to look at strategic options, including a possible sale, a restructuring, or a winding down, but many are concerned that it may be too little, too late.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • CEDC

    Shares of Central European Distribution (CEDC -23.4%) crater after the company files notice with...

    Shares of Central European Distribution (CEDC -23.4%) crater after the company files notice with the SEC that it will delay the filing of its 10-K and sees taking a $400M writedown due to goodwill in a pair of subsidiaries. (8-K)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • VCEL

    Aastrom Biosciences (ASTM -7.8%) trades near its 52-week low today, after the company reported...

    Aastrom Biosciences (ASTM -7.8%) trades near its 52-week low today, after the company reported bigger Q4 losses Y/Y in yesterday's after hours session. Bottom line margins were hit hard by heavy SG&A charges for non-cash stock based compenstation, plus higher overall R&D costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • IPCI

    IntelliPharmaCeutics (IPCI -7.8%) takes a hit today after saying it plans to raise around $3.1M...

    IntelliPharmaCeutics (IPCI -7.8%) takes a hit today after saying it plans to raise around $3.1M in a registered direct unit offering at $1.72 per unit. IPCI will issue 1.815 million common shares and warrants to purchase an additional 453,750 common shares. The warrants will be exercisable immediately, have a term of five years and an exercise price of US$2.10 per share of common stock. The offering is expected to close on or about March 22.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • SN

    The $265M Sanchez Energy (SN -1%) is paying Hess (HES -3.5%) for 43K acres of south Texas shale...

    The $265M Sanchez Energy (SN -1%) is paying Hess (HES -3.5%) for 43K acres of south Texas shale is much lower than the $820M Tudor Pickering expected, which "highlights softness in non-core Eagle Ford" shale market. The firm says the deal does not bode well for Chesapeake (CHK -5.2%); applying the price Hess received implies a $600M value to CHK's land vs. Tudor's earlier estimate of $1.25B.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 3 Comments
  • HFC

    Pipeline projects such as the proposed Keystone XL and the reversal of the Seaway won't hurt...

    Pipeline projects such as the proposed Keystone XL and the reversal of the Seaway won't hurt HollyFrontier (HFC -3.6%), CEO Michael Jennings says, thanks to its proximity to sources of inexpensive crude and the prospect of exports keeping fuel markets from being oversupplied, even if WTI prices rise. Analysts have speculated whether HFC's margins would crumble as new pipelines come online.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • TMO

    Shares of Life Technologies (LIFE +2.2%) pop on reports that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) is weighing a...

    Shares of Life Technologies (LIFE +2.2%) pop on reports that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) is weighing a bid. The drug giant joins a host of other potential bidders including: TMO, DHR, and a buyout consortium comprising BX, CG, TPG Capital and Singapore's state investor Temasek Holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • MNST

    The FDA is in receipt of a letter from a group of doctors and researchers urging the agency to...

    The FDA is in receipt of a letter from a group of doctors and researchers urging the agency to take action on the caffeine levels in energy drinks. Though large-sized coffee drinks contain a much higher level of caffeine, data on emergency room visits suggests more complications are seen from the consumption of energy drinks than other caffeinated drinks. Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST), up 2.5%, remain unfazed by the most recent attack on the energy drink industry.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 12 Comments
  • WSCI

    WSI Industries (WSCI -23%) tanks today after reporting late yesterday that FQ2 income plunged on...

    WSI Industries (WSCI -23%) tanks today after reporting late yesterday that FQ2 income plunged on flat revenue growth Y/Y. The company blames the soft quarter on a poor product mix, plus weakness in its energy business that, in combination with typical seasonality, hit its bottom line hard.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • EFUT

    Midday top 10 gainers: EFUT +53%. ATOS +29%. GST +20%. KYTH +14%. DWCH +10%. NPSP +9%. SHIP +9%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: EFUT +53%. ATOS +29%. GST +20%. KYTH +14%. DWCH +10%. NPSP +9%. SHIP +9%. CSTE +8%. OPXA +8%. LTRX +8%.
    Midday top 10 losers: OTC:AFFY -64%. MTSL -33%. HNR -33%. WSCI -23%. WAC -19%. INTX -19%. STSI -17%. TWER -14%. CLWT -13%. GMXR -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • BTX

    BioTime (BTX -7.6%) takes a hit today after reporting late Monday a Q4 loss of $0.12 per share,...

    BioTime (BTX -7.6%) takes a hit today after reporting late Monday a Q4 loss of $0.12 per share, compared with a loss of $0.11 per share in the same period last year. Revenues were $1.22M, also down from the prior-year quarter. Total revenue decreased by 9% Y/Y, primarily due to lower grant revenue stemming from the completion of it's research grant from the California Institute for Regenerative Medicine, and an overall decrease in the sale of research products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • RDC

    Rowan (RDC -3%) says it's open to forming a tax-advantaged partnership for some of its rigs,...

    Rowan (RDC -3%) says it's open to forming a tax-advantaged partnership for some of its rigs, CEO Matt Ralls says, but will let another rig contractor such as Transocean (NYSE:RIG) prove the effectiveness of the MLP structure first. “The jury’s still out" on the Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) partnership, Ralls says: “When you look at the way their stock trades, it’s not clear they’ve improved."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • AEO

    Teen-oriented retailers trade weak with negative news out on Lululemon and Kohl's tipping...

    Teen-oriented retailers trade weak with negative news out on Lululemon and Kohl's tipping sentiment in the sub-sector. Decliners: American Eagle Outfitters (AEO -2.9%), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -3.3%), Aeropostale (AEO -2.9%), Zumiez (ZUMZ -2.7%), The Bucke (BKE -2%), Urban Outfitters (URBN -2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA -7.7%) is now seeing big losses, as the Street concludes its March quarter...

    Electronic Arts (EA -7.7%) is now seeing big losses, as the Street concludes its March quarter warning takes priority over John Riccitiello's resignation. Game developers Activision (ATVI -2%), Take-Two (TTWO -1.8%), Zynga (ZNGA -1.7%), and Glu Mobile (GLUU -6.8%) are also lower, as is retailer GameStop (GME -2.3%). EA's warning comes a few days after NPD provided more downbeat retail sales data for the industry to chew on, as aged consoles and a shift to mobile gaming continue taking a toll. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • MBOT

    StemCells (STEM -3.9%) slips after reporting a Q4 loss of $0.07 per share, beating the Street...

    StemCells (STEM -3.9%) slips after reporting a Q4 loss of $0.07 per share, beating the Street consensus of $0.13 loss per share. Revenues were far short of estimates, coming in at $211K, versus analyst estimates of $330K and far below the prior year's $541K. The company attributes the decline to higher revenue from licensing agreements in 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • CLF

    Another day, another new 52-week low for Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -7.2%) after Goldman...

    Another day, another new 52-week low for Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -7.2%) after Goldman Sachs cut its price target to $20 from $24. CLF has more problems than just weak iron ore prices, the firm says, most notably the inability to control costs at its Bloom Lake mine. Yesterday, BAML cut its price target to $25, and shares plunged through BAML's barrier before the report's ink was dry.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 4 Comments

  • Stocks turn decidedly lower as Cyprus' ruling party will apparently abstain from the bailout...

    Stocks turn decidedly lower as Cyprus' ruling party will apparently abstain from the bailout vote, thus assuring its failure. The ball now moves back to Brussels, where the ECB has threatened to withhold funding from Cyprus' banks if the bailout (and depositor haircut) isn't passed. Stoxx 50 (FEZ) -1.5%, S&P 500 (SPY) -0.5%, the euro (FXE) -0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 41 Comments
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -9%) takes a hit after its Q4 beat expectations on a per share...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -9%) takes a hit after its Q4 beat expectations on a per share basis, but came up far short on revenue as net sales of Krystexxa posted a marginal 3% increase over Q3. Bottom line margins were also impacted by a cost of goods charge to Krystexxa inventory that the company doesn't believe will be sold prior to expiration.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -2.6%) expects to raise a net $4.3B in global capital markets each year to fund...

    Petrobras (PBR -2.6%) expects to raise a net $4.3B in global capital markets each year to fund its investment plan over the next five years, its CFO says, as increased crude oil production during 2013-17 covering the $236.7B investment plan allows it to reduce net financing needs by 50% vs. the 2012-16 plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • DHCP

    The hot mortgage servicing sector is getting whacked today, with the only news out being Walter...

    The hot mortgage servicing sector is getting whacked today, with the only news out being Walter Investment's (WAC -9.8%) earnings miss. The company is guiding to 2013 adjusted EBITDA of $650M-$725M vs. 2012's $241.7M. This smells like traders taking profits after some big runs in the stocks. NSM -7.2%, OCN -5.5%, HLSS -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • AUY

    Yamana Gold (AUY +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Cowen, which says 2013 looks to be a...

    Yamana Gold (AUY +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Cowen, which says 2013 looks to be a game-changing year with several projects ramping up or achieving steady-state. Relative to peers, AUY maintains a consistently low cost profile and has relatively low exposure to challenging jurisdictions, but shares have been unjustifiably under pressure due to poor performance from peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • STP

    Citi cuts its PT for Suntech (STP -11.4%) to $0.50 from $1.50, and warns the company's equity...

    Citi cuts its PT for Suntech (STP -11.4%) to $0.50 from $1.50, and warns the company's equity will be worthless if the Chinese government doesn't offer support to bondholders. However, the firm considers this an unlikely scenario, and still thinks the Wuxi, China government could buy Suntech's assets. Shares have fallen to $0.57 today. (bond default)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +1.8%) gains this morning after Deutsche Bank SRPT) with a Buy rating...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT +1.8%) gains this morning after Deutsche Bank starts coverage with a Buy. Deutsche says SRPT's Eteplirsen, a treatment for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy, is likely will be given the green light by mid-2015. The drug has a better safety profile versus its competitor Drisapersen, which will allow it to take a majority share. Fair-value of Eteplirsen in the U.S. alone is around $45 per share, and has tremendous upside potential if the street assigns value to European markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semi (LSCC +7.5%) jumps after guiding for 6%-8% Q/Q revenue growth in Q1, well above...

    Lattice Semi (LSCC +7.5%) jumps after guiding for 6%-8% Q/Q revenue growth in Q1, well above prior guidance for a 2%-4% drop. Gross margin is expected to be at the low end of a prior guidance range of 52%-56% thanks to a greater mix of telecom and consumer chip sales. Bigger rivals Altera (ALTR +0.4%) and Xilinx (XLNX +1.5%) are up slightly. This morning, Xilinx introduced a new chip for its Zynq line of SoCs. By combining DSP and ARM CPU cores with Xilinx's programmable logic, Zynq expands Xilinx's reach within embedded markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • SCMP

    Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (SCMP +6%) gets a boost this morning from Maxim initiating the shares...

    Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (SCMP +6%) gets a boost this morning from Maxim initiating the shares with a Buy rating and a price target of $10. The stock actually began trending higher last week after TheStreet.com mentioned it as one of five sub-$10 stocks that are triggering technical breakouts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • SLB

    Oilfield services companies suffer another down day after Schlumberger (SLB -1.3%) sounded an...

    Oilfield services companies suffer another down day after Schlumberger (SLB -1.3%) sounded an alarm for the sector, warning that customers have reactivated fewer rigs than expected and pricing is still an issue. It was a “clarion call of realism," Simmons says, virtually ensuring negative Q1 guidance from SLB and making positive revisions from other oil service firms "a steeper climb." HAL -1.9%, BHI -1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (ACAD +1.7%) gets a lift this morning after Jefferies initiates coverage...

    Acadia Pharmaceuticals (ACAD +1.7%) gets a lift this morning after Jefferies initiates coverage with a Buy and a $13 price target. The firm says that its lead drug in development, pimavanserin, is a treament for Parkinson's disease psychosis for which there is currently no FDA-approved counterpart. ACAD recently reported positive Phase 3 data, and Jefferies sees the drug as a highly attractive licensing/acquisition target for pharma companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.3%) is downgraded to Underperform from Neutral at Sterne Agee, which...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.3%) is downgraded to Underperform from Neutral at Sterne Agee, which criticizes CHK's hedging strategies and cautions that the pricing of upcoming asset sales could underwhelm. Spending plans are highly dependent on further asset sales, the firm says, and it believes 2013 guidance could be at risk with a $3B-plus funding gap remaining.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • INFN

    Goldman upgrades Infinera (INFN +4%) to Neutral, leading shares to close in on their YTD highs....

    Goldman upgrades Infinera (INFN +4%) to Neutral, leading shares to close in on their YTD highs. The firm cites a better-than-expected launch for Infinera's 100G DTN-X optical transmission system and a belief Q1 will represent a gross margin bottom. The firm observes Infinera has a "razor and blades" business model in which low-margin chassis shipments are followed by a high-margin line card shipments. Yesterday, Infinera announced Asian carrier Pacnet is deploying its 100G DTN-X systems to provide submarine long-haul links.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • CAH

    AmerisourceBergen's distribution deal with Walgreen means that the latter's contract with...

    AmerisourceBergen's distribution deal with Walgreen means that the latter's contract with Cardinal Health (CAH -7%) will end in August. Cardinal tries to put a brave face on things, saying it's targeting EPS from continuing ops at least similar to FY 2013's projected $3.42-3.50. And while Walgreen accounted for 21% of Cardinal's revenue in FY 2012, the non-renewal will lead to a "meaningful" net benefit to cash flow in FY 2014. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • JNPR

    A harsh downgrade to Sell from Goldman sends Juniper (JNPR -4.5%) lower. The firm is worried...

    A harsh downgrade to Sell from Goldman sends Juniper (JNPR -4.5%) lower. The firm is worried about share loss and margin pressure in the carrier router space (42% of 2013E sales) thanks to Alcatel-Lucent's (ALU) 2012 arrival, sees Juniper's switching share flattening thanks to Cisco's Nexus 6000 launch and the impact of software-defined networking, and expects "continued share loss" in security hardware thanks to "product feature gaps and the cannibalistic effect on sales from the transition to a software model." 2013-2015 estimates have been lowered.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • LULU

    Reaction to Lululemon (LULU -4.7%): Calculators are burning up as analysts try to compute the...

    Reaction to Lululemon (LULU -4.7%): Calculators are burning up as analysts try to compute the impact of the retailer's yoga pants fiasco on short-term profits and on the long-term reputation for the brand. A potential sticking point for the company is that selling men's clothing may he harder after the recall of  the "too sheer" pants. Look for a spirited defense from Lululemon CEO Christine Day during the firm's post-earnings conference call on Thursday. (Previous: guidance cut, fallback)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • ABC

    AmerisourceBergen (NYSE:ABC) jumps 6.1% out the gate after it signs a 10-year distribution deal...

    AmerisourceBergen (NYSE:ABC) jumps 6.1% out the gate after it signs a 10-year distribution deal with Walgreen and Alliance Boots in which the latter two companies will also have the right to buy up to 23% in AmerisourceBergen. The deal will boost the distributor's revenues by $28B and EPS by $0.20 in FY 2014. However, it will pressure margins, and AmerisourceBergen cuts its FY 2013 EPS to $2.96-3.06 from $3.06-3.16 previously. Still, it raises its revenue growth forecast to 8-11% from 6-9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • SPRD

    An upgrade to Buy from Chardan Capital sends Spreadtrum (SPRD +3.5%) higher. The upgrade comes...

    An upgrade to Buy from Chardan Capital sends Spreadtrum (SPRD +3.5%) higher. The upgrade comes shortly after chairman/CEO Leo Li told the EE Times Spreadtrum is a major beneficiary of China's low-end smartphone boom. Li touts the appeal of Spreadtrum's low-cost 1GHz., single-core, 2G and 3G baseband/app processors, and notes the company's efforts to develop 3G WCDMA and 4G TD-LTE processors. However, the site observes Spreadtrum is increasingly butting heads with MediaTek, which has a stronger mid-range smartphone position.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • RCPI

    Shares of Star Scientific (STSI -8.6%) crumble with a new SEC filing out from the company...

    Shares of Star Scientific (STSI -8.6%) crumble with a new SEC filing out from the company revealing it received subpoenas from the U.S. Attorney's Office in Eastern Virginia. (10-K)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • LSG

    Lake Share Gold (NYSEMKT:LSG) +9.5% premarket after reporting "solid progress" in 2012,...

    Lake Share Gold (NYSEMKT:LSG) +9.5% premarket after reporting "solid progress" in 2012, producing ~85K oz. of gold for the full year and nearing completion of key construction programs.
